channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street cleaners needed, 7th January
item.description:
Please can street cleaners attend Ruston Road regularly Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ruston Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6+ children, mixed ages running round on ice., 7th January
item.description:
Friary Park. Children running round on ice on the new flood relief pools at the lower end of the park. It was absolutely inevitable and has not been properly risk assessed. Whilst presently they are shallow water on mud the potential for danger is obvious. Children have also been running round on the ridges between the pond for some months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friary Road, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hot dpot for dog fouling, 7th January
item.description:
Always a big problem here. I think local residents are responsible- there are no bins on this stretch Please can we request bins for dog waste and normal bins, plus signage, thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mast Quay, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy pavement, 7th January

item.title: You need to grit this every day, 7th January
item.description:
The whole path to and from the bridge and behind the houses along the track is completely lethal. I slipped twice and saw 5 other people slip in various places. Please grit the entire route every morning as it's so busy with the bridge closure at the station
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Dangerous road and pavements due to a failure to grit the roads and pavements, 7th January
item.description:
Since the cold weather, the council have failed to grit the roads and pavements. My son almost fell in the road on Birkbeck Road. After dropping him to school, I almost fell on Sydney Road. This is not OK. This is dangerous and the council need to sort this out. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Road Gulley, 7th January
item.description:
The Road Gully on the pedestrian crossing is blocked, I have been reporting this regularly since 2020 and it is still blocked. The crossing is flooded.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tulse Hill, Brixton, Greater London

item.title: Huge puddle at bus stop L, 7th January
item.description:
Very large puddle at bus stop L at Carlton Parade buses going towards Nugent Shipping Centre. This is causing issues when buses pull up at the bus stop and inconsiderate drivers driving through the puddle. This is an ongoing problem and has never been resolved and needs sorting out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 62 Charlton Church Lane graffiti, 7th January
item.description:
This commercial property owners' removed its windows, boarded it up before Christmas and now this has been covered in graffiti As well as removing the graffiti (and recharging the negligent owner) RBG hS the powers under the TCPA and Building Control Act to get the shopfront properly restored.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Church Lane, Charlton

item.title: Black ice on pavement, 7th January
item.description:
North side of Tower Bridge, blocked drain in road causing flooding in road. This standing water is getting sprayed across the pavement which is causing black ice to form. Several people have slipped on it this morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Bridge Approach, Whitechapel, Greater London

item.title: No road gritting / people falling / very dangerous, 7th January
item.description:
Just witnessed a poor woman full horribly because the pavements weren‚Äôt gritted with salt and they haven‚Äôt been for weeks despite the temperature being the same and this road being listed on your Bromley greeting website it has never at any point been gritted this winter. she isn‚Äôt the first person who‚Äôs slipped on the pavement, its horrible and causing an immediate danger to a lot of people. Thousands of people use it a day to obtain access to crystal palace station for work or school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
